recipes.name: Jipijapa Ceviche
recipes.description: A traditional Manabí-style ceviche made with fish, a peanut-based sauce, and citrus flavors typical of the region.
steps: Cook the fish in salted water.
Blend peanuts with achiote to create a creamy base.
Add chopped tomato and red onion.
Mix in the shredded fish.
Add lime juice, cilantro, and adjust seasoning.
recipes.tips: Serve with plantain chips or patacones.

recipes.name: Encebollado
recipes.description: One of Ecuador’s most iconic dishes, made with albacore tuna, cassava, and a flavorful onion and tomato broth.
steps: Cook the tuna with cumin and salt.
Remove and shred the tuna.
Prepare a sauté of onion, tomato, and achiote.
Add the sauté to the broth together with cassava.
Serve with shredded tuna and pickled onions.
recipes.tips: Usually served with plantain chips and avocado.

recipes.name: Chicken Stew (Seco de Pollo)
recipes.description: A traditional Ecuadorian stew made with chicken cooked in a sauce of beer, naranjilla, and local spices.
steps: Prepare a sauté with onion, garlic, and achiote.
Add the chicken pieces and brown them.
Pour in the beer and naranjilla.
Simmer until the chicken becomes tender.
Serve with rice and avocado.

recipes.name: Guatita
recipes.description: A traditional Ecuadorian dish made with beef tripe cooked in a thick peanut sauce.
steps: Cook the tripe until tender.
Prepare a sauté with onion, garlic, and achiote.
Add blended peanuts and milk.
Add diced potatoes.
Add chopped tripe and cook until thickened.

recipes.name: Fritada
recipes.description: A classic Andean dish consisting of slow-cooked pork that browns in its own fat. Traditionally served with hominy and potatoes.
steps: Cook the pork with garlic, onion, cumin, and water.
Allow the water to evaporate so the pork browns in its fat.
Serve with hominy, potato patties, and salad.

recipes.name: Fish in Coconut Sauce (Encocado)
recipes.description: A flavorful coastal dish consisting of fish cooked in a creamy coconut-based sauce.
steps: Prepare a sauté with onion, garlic, bell pepper, and achiote.
Add coconut milk and simmer.
Add the fish and cook gently until tender.
Add cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Humitas
recipes.description: A steamed corn cake made from fresh ground corn, wrapped in corn husks. Can be sweet or savory.
steps: Grind the corn with milk.
Add butter, egg, and cheese.
Place the mixture inside corn husks.
Steam until cooked.

recipes.name: Quimbolitos
recipes.description: Soft, sweet steamed cakes made with corn flour and wrapped in achira leaves.
steps: Mix all ingredients into a smooth batter.
Spoon into achira leaves.
Steam until firm and fluffy.

recipes.name: Menestra
recipes.description: A traditional Ecuadorian stew of lentils or beans served with rice and grilled meat.
steps: Prepare a sauté with onion, tomato, and achiote.
Add cooked lentils or beans.
Season with cumin and cilantro.
Serve with rice and grilled meat.

recipes.name: Potato Soup (Locro de Papas)
recipes.description: A hearty potato soup made with cheese, milk, and served with avocado.
steps: Prepare a sauté with onion, garlic, and achiote.
Add diced potatoes and water.
Cook until the potatoes break down.
Add milk and cheese.
Serve with avocado slices.
